automaticTaskDTO Data Type

An automatic task template that gets instantiated when incidents are created or updated.

Namespace
(Default)
Properties
name data type type namespace min/max occurs description
associated_actions objectHandle element 0/unbounded List of actions that are associated with this automatic task. When the automatic task is saved, the task will be added to all actions that appear in the list. Conversely, the task will be removed from any action that does not appear in the list. If the value is an empty list, then the task will be removed from all actions. If the value is null, then the field will be ignored (ie. the task will not be added or removed from any action).
category_id objectHandle element 0/1 The category this automatic task belongs to.
due_date_offset int element 1/1 The number of units. If dueDateUnits is "days" then a value of one in this field means that the task is to be due "1 day" after it was discovered.
due_date_units string element 0/1 The units for the due date. Allowed values: "days", "months", "years".
enabled boolean element 1/1 Is the automatic task enabled?
export_key string element 0/1 The key which uniquely identifies the object being imported
id int element 1/1 The ID of the automatic task.
incident_types objectHandle element 0/unbounded The list of incident types for which this automatic task is to be instantiated. The automatic task will be instantiated for incidents who have any of these incident types. See also fullOrgDTO.incident_types (contains a list of all incident type IDs and their corresponding names).
NOTE: This is deprecated as of V28. Starting with V27 incident types are no longer associated with automatic tasks directly. This field was preserved in V28 to provide information about actions that had conditions on incident type. However attempting to create automatic tasks with incident types results in an error. Use the ActionREST endpoint to manage actions and conditions (including incident type conditions).
instructions string element 0/1 The instructions for the task. This should generally be HTML, although it will be cleansed to remove possible cross site scripting issues.
name string element 0/1 The display name of the automatic task.
optional boolean element 1/1 Is the automatic task to be an optional task when instantiated?
phase_id objectHandle element 0/1 The phase this automatic task belongs to
programmatic_name string element 0/1 The programmatic name of the automatic task. This is how consumers will identify the automatic task by name via the API. If not sent, the programmatic name will be unchanged (in the update case), or will be automatically generated (in the create case).
uuid string element 0/1 A unique identifier for the automatic task.

Example

<automaticTaskDTO>
  <id>...</id>
  <name>...</name>
  <optional>...</optional>
  <due_date_units>...</due_date_units>
  <due_date_offset>...</due_date_offset>
  <instructions>...</instructions>
  <enabled>...</enabled>
  <phase_id>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </phase_id>
  <category_id>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </category_id>
  <uuid>...</uuid>
  <export_key>...</export_key>
  <programmatic_name>...</programmatic_name>
  <associated_actions>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </associated_actions>
</automaticTaskDTO>
